author: Cody Ault
comment: Works just as well as the roku app. Doesn't have all the same bell's and whistles, but works great on my smart watch and is exactly what I was looking for
just keep saying phone not found. No support to help me resolve the issue. very disappointed, uninstalling!

reply.author: Appestry
reply.content: Please email us for troubleshooting steps. We'll be glad to help.

author: Philip Korkus
comment: I use this app almost exclusively when watching TV on Roku now when doing chores around the house. It's never failed to work once. Dependable! Practical! User-friendly! Really great smartwatch app.

author: jereme ball
comment: Doesn't even read my Roku worst possible app I've ever had and I wish I could get a half hour of my life back wasting the time of downloading it

reply.author: Appestry
reply.content: It's possible the WiFi router is blocking port 8060. If the phone app doesn't detect your Roku and if you're not able to add it manually using the IP address then please open this link in http://roku-ip-address:8060 with your Roku's IP address. If you don't get any response then port 8060 is blocked. If not please email us, we'll be glad to help.

author: Jeff Wahlund
comment: Very handy app. Even works on wear 2.0. when I'm on the phone I can pause or turn off my Roku. One of my favorite apps.

author: B. White
comment: Wow. Really? This app is for a '5 minute free trial." After 5 minutes, the app purposefully delays the command sent to your Roku so you have to wait a few seconds before anything happens. Even with the dumb delay, it still didn't work. Garbage. Uninstall.

reply.author: Appestry
reply.content: Thank you for the feedback! Let us know what doesn't work. We'll be glad to help.

reply.author: Appestry

author: Jonathan Rondon

author: Patrick Evans
comment: Occasionally gives the 5 second delay even though I bought the premium version. EDIT 1: Developer has recommended I open the phone app and select 'Open remote in smartwatch' button when the issue happens again.

reply.author: Appestry
reply.content: Thank you for the feedback. This happens when the phone and watch can't communicate with each other when you start the watch app. To solve this issue please open the phone app and select 'Open remote in smartwatch' button any time you see the delay in the watch. Please let us know if that doesn't fix the issue.

author: Jay Petrie
comment: Works great with my Asus zenwatch. Don't worry anymore looking for the remote control. The only thing it needs is handle volume control and then is perfect.
title: Great app

author: Glenn Knoblock
comment: Doesn't work on s2 after I Paid for it

reply.author: Appestry
reply.content: Please email us more details on the issue. Or, if you'd like a refund, please email us your Google Play order#. Either way we'll be glad to help.

title: Roku remote

comment: Too many ads
title: Ads

author: Katie Stack
comment: Love it so much.
title: Roku

author: Robak Maly
comment: Ok

author: John Jacobs
comment: Decent

author: David BTB
comment: Very basic. Works every time. I use this when big flashy Peel Smart Remote can't talk to my Roku (which is often). Android wear support is great when I am in the other room and forget to pause Hulu and hear my program starting or listening to Pandora while doing housework. Only failing is, it needs to relay through the app on my phone. Even if my Moto360 is connected to my WiFi, I can't stray too far from my phone.

reply.author: Appestry
reply.content: Thank you for the feedback. Currently the smartwatch app needs the phone app to communicate with Roku, whether using Bluetooth or WiFi. We'll keep you updated when we release a direct communication feature from watch to Roku.

title: Simple - Works - Needs phone

author: Michael Johnson
comment: Seems to forget that I got the premium version for Android wear and adds that arbitrary delay whenever I try to control anything on me watch. And as far as I know, this is the only app that has a full remote for Wear so I really wish it worked properly.

reply.author: Appestry
reply.content: Thank you for letting us know. Please email your Google Play order# so we could look it up.

title: Keeps downgrading me to the trial version

author: Lisa Wilson
comment: Good app all features work the ads are all I don't like
title: It's ok the ads make it a pain

author: Eunice Ramirez
comment: The remote works well. But my eyes must stay on the remote because ads would pop up; and I can accidentally press it rather than the remote's button. It is so annoying.

reply.author: Appestry
reply.content: Thank you for the feedback. Upgrading the app will remove ads completely and also remove the 5 minute time limit in the smartwatch.
